nl.esciencecenter.xenon

Class XenonFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.esciencecenter.xenon.XenonFactory

  • public final class XenonFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    XenonFactory is used to create and end Xenon instances. Make sure to always end instances when you no longer need them, otherwise they remain allocated.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void endAll()
      End all Xenon instances created by this factory.
      static void endXenon(Xenon xenon)
      Ends a Xenon instance.
      static Xenon newXenon(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
      Create a new Xenon instance using the given properties.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • newXenon

        public static Xenon newXenon(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
                      throws XenonException
        Create a new Xenon instance using the given properties. The properties provided will be passed to the Xenon instance and its adaptors on creation time. Note that a XenonException will be thrown if properties contains any unknown keys. Also, make sure to always end Xenon instances by calling endXenon() when you no longer need them, otherwise their associated resources remain allocated.
        Parameters:
        properties - (optional) properties used to configure the newly created Xenon instance.
        Returns:
        a new Xenon instance.
        Throws:
        UnknownPropertyException - If an unknown property was passed.
        InvalidPropertyException - If a known property was passed with an illegal value.
        XenonException - If the Xenon failed initialize.

      • endXenon

        public static void endXenon(Xenon xenon)
                     throws XenonException
        Ends a Xenon instance. Ending a Xenon instance will automatically close local resources, such as Schedulers, FileSystems and Credentials. In addition, all non online Jobs it has created will be killed (for example jobs that run locally).
        Parameters:
        xenon - the Xenon to end.
        Throws:
        NoSuchXenonException - If the Xenon was not found
        XenonException - If the Xenon failed to end.

      • endAll

        public static void endAll()
        End all Xenon instances created by this factory. All exceptions thrown during endAll are ignored.
